C++ pointer

13 Nov 2018 • Gmimg

Category: C++
Tags: C++, Pointer
  • Pointer
  • Dynamically allocated array
  • delete, Destructor

Pointer definition : Memory address of a variable

Add “*” must be before each variable

#include <iostream>
#include <string>
using namespace std;
void newLine();

class Student
{
public:
	Student();
	~Student();
	void InputData(); // Input all data from user
	void OutputData(); // Output class list to console
	void ResetClasses(); // Reset class list
	Student& operator =(const Student& rightSide); // Assignment operator
private:
	string name;
	int numClasses;
	string *classList;
};


// ======================
// main function
// ======================
int main()
{
	// Test our code with two student classes
	Student s1, s2;
	s1.InputData(); // Input data for student 1
	cout << "Student 1's data:" << endl;
	s1.OutputData(); // Output data for student 1
	cout << endl;
	s2 = s1;
	cout << "Student 2's data after assignment from student 1:" << endl;
	s2.OutputData(); // Should output same data as for student 1
	s1.ResetClasses();
	cout << "Student 1's data after reset:" << endl;
	s1.OutputData(); // Should have no classes
	cout << "Student 2's data, should still have original classes:" << endl;
	s2.OutputData(); // Should still have original classes
	cout << endl;
	return 0;
}


Student::Student()
{
	name = "";
	numClasses = 0;
	classList=NULL;
}
Student::~Student()
{
	if (classList != NULL)
	delete [] classList;
}
void Student::InputData()
{
	cout << "Enter student name." << endl;
	string in_name;
	getline(cin, in_name);
	name = in_name;
	cout << "Enter number of classes." << endl;
	int cls;
	cin >> cls;
	newLine();
	numClasses = cls;

	classList = new string[numClasses];
	string st;
	for (int i = 0; i < numClasses; i++)
	{
		cout << "Enter name of class " << i+1 << endl;
		getline(cin,st);
		classList[i] = st;
	}
}
void Student::OutputData()
{
	cout << "Name: " << name << endl;
	cout << "Number of classes : " << numClasses << endl;
	for (int i = 0; i < numClasses; i++)
		cout << "Class " << i << " : " << classList[i] << endl;
}
void Student::ResetClasses()
{
	if(classList != NULL)
	{
		delete[] classList;
		classList = NULL;
	}
	numClasses = 0;
}
Student& Student::operator =(const Student& rightSide)
{
	if (this == &rightSide)
		return *this;
	else
	{
		name = rightSide.name;
		numClasses = rightSide.numClasses;
		delete[] classList;
		classList = new string[numClasses];
		for (int i = 0; i < numClasses; i++)
		{
			classList[i] = rightSide.classList[i];
		}
	}
	return *this;
}
void newLine()
{
	char nextChar;
	do
	{
		cin.get(nextChar);
	} while (nextChar != '\n');
}
